capsules_submitted.utterance: Petunia's lineage is quite interesting. I've been studying the maculogy of that particular plant, and it seems to be a confirmed fact that Petunia has a specific genetic makeup that affects its appearance.

Apparently, they have this condition called maculogy which affects the coloration of their leaves. It's a bit of a concern for gardeners who want to grow them, but at the same time, it's also kind of fascinating to learn about these unique characteristics that set them apart from other plants.
